content.description:
Start standing ,matched on a big right facing slopey shelf . Work balancy moves up more slopers to a cool big move to a horizontal finger crack at 12 ft. Match here and make a long lock of to good ledges and slopers. High step and top out. youtube: bouldering hope bc : my pet monster This climb is 30 feet to the right of Laquer Head boulder problem. Pads
The landing slopes down and away

Sit start to the right of the sharp lip, traverse all the way to the left. Can be done with or without the ledge or campusing etc.



start 2m right of Ty's parkour

Start matched from a feature on a the sloping lip, move right, and slap your way up the featureless bulge.

The feature broke may be harder now



100m Up the hill from Laquer Head

Pad

This problem is to the right of My Pet Monster on the Shinobi Boulder. 
 Start with left hand undercling and right on good crimp. Make a tough pull left hand to sharp crimp. Bring right hand up to a small, flat, slippery pinch.  Trace feet to start hold and make a Big, technical deadpoint to a left hand edge.Scary Dyno right hand to jug. Highball finish on jugs.


Shinobi boulder

Silver Lake

Hope BC

Facing the shore of the lake turn left (north west) into the bush, a trail fades in and out. Mostly out at the end where a jumble of tree make the ground hard to navigate. 30min walk 1km approximately

Pads. This climbs over a big rock sticking out of the ground. We brought a short rope (20m) and rigged pads over it. Probably want 4 good pads.

Start matched at the back of the roof and make a huge reach to the start feature for Berzerk. Fight gravity to match the other hand and finish as for Berzerk.

the feature broke might be harder now


See Berzerk
Pad

▪︎start low on cool holds▪︎climb up and left of the bulge▪︎very good, the direct exit of screwdriver.



on the shinobi boulder number 3 but exit before traversing all the way left

same start as Gin and Juice and Screwdriver but continue straight up using the right side of the boulder▪︎Tops out directly above the start hold▪︎also very good 



number 4 on picture

Start in the middle of the large, horizontal crack that runs the length of this massive boulder. Paste feet and make big moves to a sloping shelf. Mantle the shelf and reach up to a funky series of underclings and upside down pinches. Work these holds to a good ledge at 16ft. Move through the ledge right into a descent stance, compose yourself then head up and left. The hands get better and better, but the feet get worse and worse. The last hold is a jug but you finish the climb by grabbing a root then a small tree. Needs a scrub From the silver lake day use area take the trail to the left of the picnic benches. Follow the obvious trail for 5-10 minutes. Laquer Head is the middle line on the first giant set of boulder stacks you encounter. Obvious horizontal crack 5 feet up from the ground. Pads
Would recommend pre inspection from rope.
First 15ft V7, second 15-18 feet V2/3

start on the big ledge and make a big move back under the tree to the sloping arete. Work around the arete into the blank face. Hard and sequency.



On the cluster of boulders before shinobi, 3meter to the right of Technical swedish trash.

This is the stand start to the "steep" project on the shinobi boulder. Start with a good 3 finger right hand crimp at about 6 feet, and poor left hand crimp. Move left to a positive crimp and then cross right to a little pinch/crimp. Bring left hand over to crimp and set up for the crux dyno to a good ledge. From the ledge move right on a sloper to a right hand pinch, heel the ledge and reach! Fun topout. The obvious lowstart is still a project. Left side of the shinobi boulder.
From silver lake day use area take the trail by the picnic tables on the left. Follow the trail and the water for 15-20 min. The trail fades in and out but if you stay with the shore line you will pass many other boulders and eventually the big overhanging shinobi boulder.
There are 3 climbed lines so far. pads Left side of the shinobi boulder.
From silver lake day use area take the trail by the picnic tables on the left. Follow the trail and the water for 15-20 min. The trail fades in and out but if you stay with the shore line you will pass many other boulders and eventually the big overhanging shinobi boulder.
There are 3 climbed lines so far. pads

▪︎start to the right of the boulder, low on cool holds as for gin and juice▪︎climb up and when possible traverse the very long rail all the way across the boulder▪︎crumbly .



On the shinobi boulder 3meter to the right of The dead point

The left arete of the offwidth from a crouch start.



Within the cluster of boulders 100 metersbefore shinobi/my pet monster

Start seated under the big ledge, mantle it up, do a little hop onto the sharp lip and top out.

Part 2 jump into crack my toe jam. Risky

Part 3 Jump back from the top of toe jam . VERY risky.



Same start as lay down sally

Sit start the middle overhanging arete.



On the trail, 2m from the shore, 300 meters after Laquer head, 400meters before my pet monster
